source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 善丈夫！
translation: A good man!

source_sentence: 汝今乃說是甚深陀羅尼乎。
translation: "Now, are you teaching this very profound dhāraṇī?

source_sentence: 若有讀誦、受持此陀羅尼者，常廣思惟。
translation: If someone recites and accepts this dhāraṇī, they should always contemplate it thoroughly.

source_sentence: 彼族姓子，當得此等諸佛世尊恒常滿足彼之所願。』
translation: That clansman will then attain the constant fulfillment of his vows by these buddhas and world-honored ones.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，香明如來以其舌根，遍覆三千大千世界，然後告彼七十七那由他菩薩言：『若有良家子、良家女，受持此陀羅尼章句，若讀、若誦，隨力當作供養，彼為此等諸佛世尊，所有心願皆悉滿足。』
translation: "At the time, the Incense Bright Tathāgata covered the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds with the tip of his tongue and then addressed the 77 nayutas, saying, 'If a good son or good daughter accepts this dhāraṇī and makes offerings according to his or her ability, then all their wishes will be fulfilled for these world-honored buddhas.'

source_sentence: 爾時，教發菩薩摩訶薩白香光如來，作如是言：『世尊！
translation: It was then that the bodhisattva Mahāsattva Teachings and Initiatives said to the Incense Light Tathāgata, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼等云何而作供養，供養彼等諸佛如來？』
translation: How do they make offerings to these Tathāgatas?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，世尊告彼教發菩薩，作如是言：『良家姓子，若有初發心行菩薩初發業者，又欲得滿一切願者，彼於晨朝時，以瞿摩塗地，隨力香花而供養已，去離世談，晝三遍、夜三遍，誦彼諸佛如來名號及此陀羅尼，而彼即得現見諸法，漸得滅除一切業障，以諸如來真實持故。』
translation: After saying this, the Bhagavān addressed the bodhisattvas who had been initiated into the teaching and said, 'Good sons, if there are bodhisattvas who have just begun to practice with the intention of starting their career and want to fulfill all their vows, then in the morning, when it's morning, after coating the ground with gomaya and making offerings with fragrant flowers of appropriate strength, go away from the worldly conversation and recite the names of the Tathāgatas and this dhāraṇī three times during the day and three times at night, and they will then be able to see the Dharma in action and gradually cease all the hindrances of karma because the Tathāgatas truly maintain it.'

source_sentence: 「南無月光如來「多緻他(一)　氈達唎(皆羅施反)(二)　氈達唎(三)　蘇氈達唎(四)　沬帝氈達唎(五)　氈達唎吱(吉支反)囉尼泥(去)(六)　彌唎彌唎(七)　佛陀提瑟呹(耻壹反)帝(八)　四履四履達摩提瑟呹帝(九)　莎呵(十)「若有善男子、善女人，於晨朝時，常當精勤專念彼等如來名號，而彼人輩，四萬劫常識宿命，亦不忘失菩提之心。
translation: "Namu Tsukuyū Tathāgata 'Tathāgata(1) Caitra(jñānaprasthāna)(2) Caitra(jñānaprasthāna)(3) Suscitra(4) Šuddhacitra(5) Caitra(jñānaprasthāna)(5) Caitra(jñānaprasthāna)(6) Mili Mili(7) Buddhadatta(jñānaprasthāna)(8) Dharmadatta(jñānaprasthāna)(9) Sahā (10) 'If there are good sons and good women who always diligently concentrate on reciting the names of the Tathāgatas during the morning hours, then they will never lose their awareness of their past lives for 40,000 eons, nor will they forget their mind of enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「南無一切趣清淨王如來「多緻他(一)　輸達儞輸達儞(儞字悉年隸反)　薩婆波頗毘輸達儞輸悌　毘輸悌　薩婆達摩毘輸悌　莎呵「若有善男子、善女人，常能受持此如來名號，精勤憶念，不忘失者，即得現見一切諸法，盡諸業障及盡諸惡，以佛真實住持力故，當於十四俱致世中，常憶宿命，乃至菩提，善根亦不窮盡。
translation: "Homage to the Tathāgata Clear King of all destinies, the Tathāgata (1) Śuddhânī śuddhânī (the letter śinanlı), Sāvabhāvaṃ-viśuddhânī śuddhânī, and Sāvadharma-viśuddhânī, "If good sons and good women always retain the name of the Tathāgata, diligently recollect it, and don't lose it, they will be able to see all things clearly, end the karmic hindrances, and end all evil, and because of the Buddha's true abiding power, they will always remember past lives throughout the 14 kalpas up to enlightenment, and their good roots won't be exhausted.

source_sentence: 「南無清淨眼如來「多緻他(一)　斫芻斫芻(二)　若那斫芻(三)　莎呵(諸莎則長聲，呵則去聲)「若善男子、善女人，持此如來之名號者，彼於世間當作眼目，常能憶持四十俱致宿命之事，乃至道場，善根不盡。
translation: "Homage to the Tathāgata Clear Eyes, "Tathāgata (1) cakra-cakra (2) jñāna-cakra (3) sahā (the sahās are long in sound and the sahās are short in sound)." "If good sons and good women bear the name of this Tathāgata, they will be regarded as eyes in the world and will always be able to remember the past lives of the forty kalpas up to the place of enlightenment, and their good roots will not end.

source_sentence: 「南無香象光王如來「多緻他(一)　揭誓揭誓(二)　揭誓延(以佃反)悌唎(三)　莎呵」「爾時，勝聚菩薩白佛言：『若有善男子、善女人，持此香象光王如來名號者，彼於十三俱致歲中，身出香氣不曾休息，亦不廢忘菩提之心。』
translation: "Homage to Tathāgata Xiangxiangguangwang Tathāgata, "Tathāgata (1) Gajyagajyau (2) Gajyāyana (in English) Tiryān (3) Sahā" "At the time, the bodhisattva Jeta said to the Buddha, 'If there are good sons and good women who bear the name of this Tathāgata Xiangxiangguangwang, their bodies will emit fragrance without ever resting, and they won't abandon their mind of enlightenment during their 13 kalpas.'

source_sentence: 「南無花相如來「多緻他(一)　布澁閉(二)　布澁閉(三)　蘇(引)布澁閉(四)　莎呵「此陀羅尼，多有功能。
translation: "Homage to the Tathāgata Flower Appearance Tathāgata, 'Tathāgata (1) Auditorium (2) Auditorium (3) Auditorium (4) Auditorium (5) [for the purpose of] promoting enlightenment,' says Shahe, 'This dhāraṇī is quite versatile.

source_sentence: 以陀羅尼呪華二十一遍，如所備具，向如來塔中散之，彼人所有心願皆得滿足，復盡一切業障。
translation: When you distribute a dhāraṇī spell with flowers twenty-one times, as prepared, into the Tathāgata's stūpa, all of his mental vows will be fulfilled, and all of his karmic hindrances will be ended.

source_sentence: 「南無治地王如來「多著他(一)　達唎達唎(二)　達囉尼盤地(三)　莎呵「若有人持此如來名字，及此陀羅尼章句，彼人當滿一切心願。
translation: "Homage to the Tathāgata Mahārāja, the King of Healing Stages, "Tathāgata (1) Dāraṇī Dāraṇī (2) Dhāraṇī Pandi (3) Sahā," says the Tathāgata, "If someone retains this Tathāgata's name and these words and phrases of the dhāraṇī, they will fulfill all their heartfelt vows.

source_sentence: 誦此呪一百八遍，即當一切諸地方所，皆成結界，隨得供具供養如來，即滿一切所有諸願。
translation: Reciting this dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times will cause all places to form a border, and then he or she will be able to make offerings to the Tathāgata and fulfill all of his or her vows.

source_sentence: 「有佛名日月燈明，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持是佛名號，　　更不生諸惡趣中。
translation: "There's a Buddha named Sun, Moon, and Lamp Light, who now teaches the Dharma lion, and if you can bear his name, you'll no longer be born in the bad destinies.

source_sentence: 有佛名日月燈光，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　當得總持能巧知。
translation: There's a Buddha named Candra, the lamp of the sun and moon, and it's now said that he's the teacher of men. If you can bear his name, you'll attain a comprehensive maintenance and skillful knowledge.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰電燈明，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名者，　　不曾生於惡趣中。
translation: There's a Buddha named Dīpaṃkara, which is now called the lion of men, and if someone can bear his name, they won't be born in a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰最勝燈，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　諸相未曾有缺少。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is The Greatest Lamp, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men, and if he can hold his name, there's never a lack of characteristics.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰住真實，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　其口常出優鉢香。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is Abiding Truth, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men, and if he can hold his name, his mouth will always give off the fragrance of utpala.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰智燈明，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　大得行行於智中。

source_sentence: 有佛名曰燈明主，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　當照世間猶如燈。

source_sentence: 有佛名曰威德住，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　一切諸方威顯赫。

source_sentence: 有佛名曰陀羅住，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　令眾甘露得充足。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is Dhārajī, and it's now said that he's the teacher of men, so if he can bear his name, the nectar of all people will be abundant.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰空燈明，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　能令驚怖著有者。
translation: The Buddha's name is Emptiness Luminosity, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men who, if he can bear his name, will cause fear to attach to existence.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰實燈明，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　當說于經不染著。

source_sentence: 有佛名曰實燈號，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　驚怖一切諸外道。
translation: "The name of the Buddha is truly Dōshō, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men. If he can hold his name, he'll frighten all non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰誓空行，　　現在說法人師子，　若有持彼佛名號，　　能脫多數千家生。
translation: The Buddha's name is Vowing to Practice Emptiness, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men. If someone holds his name, they'll be able to escape the birth of many thousands of families.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰盡邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若有持彼佛名號，　　當得速知眼邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is Ending Limits, and it's now said that he's a teacher of men, so if someone holds his name, they'll quickly know the limits of their eyes.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰盡邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若有持彼佛名號，　　當能速知耳邊際。

source_sentence: 有佛名曰名邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知事邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the borderline of fame, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a legal practitioner can hold onto the name of that Buddha, they'll then know the borderline of things.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰事邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知鳴邊際。
translation: There's the borderline of a Buddha's name being called a thing, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can hold on to that Buddha's name, he'll know the borderline of sounding.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰鳴邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知施邊際。
translation: There's the borderline of a Buddha's name being called 'sounding,' and it's now said that if a teacher of legal practitioners can hold that Buddha's name, he'll know the borderline of giving.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰施邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知戒邊際。
translation: There's the limit of giving when the Buddha's name is called the limit of generosity, and it's now said that if a teacher of legal practitioners can bear the name of that Buddha, he'll know the limit of precepts.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰戒邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若有持彼佛名號，　　即得了知忍邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the limit of morality, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, then he'll know the limit of forbearance.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰住忍辱，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知精進際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is called the limit of abiding patience, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, he'll attain the limit of knowing effort.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰住精進，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知禪邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is abiding in effort, and it's now said that if a man, teacher or son of a man, can hold to his Buddha's name, he'll then know the limits of meditation.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰住禪那，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知般若際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is Abiding Meditation, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, he'll know the limits of prajñā.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰住般若，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知慈邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is Abiding Prajñā, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, he'll know the limits of kindness.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰慈邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若有持彼佛名號，　　即得了知悲邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the limit of kindness, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, then he'll know the limit of pity.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰悲邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知喜邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the limit of pity, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, he'll know the limit of joy.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰喜邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知捨邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the border of joy, and it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma exists, he can hold onto the name of that Buddha and realize the border of equanimity.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰捨邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知華邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the border of equanimity, and it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma exists, he can hold on to the name of that Buddha, and then he'll know the border of flowers.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰華邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知鬘邊際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is called the border of flowers, and it's now said that if a teacher of Buddhists can bear his name, he'll then know the border of garlands.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰鬘邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知音聲際。
translation: There's the borderline of the Buddha's name being called garland, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear his name, he'll know the borderline of sound.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰音聲際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知香邊際。
translation: There's the borderline of the Buddha's name being sound, and it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma exists, he can hold onto the name of that Buddha and attain knowledge of the borderline of fragrance.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰香邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知然香際。
translation: There's the limit of the Buddha's name, which is fragrance, and it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma can hold onto the name of that Buddha, then he'll know the limit of natural fragrance.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰然香際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知傘蓋際。
translation: There's the border of fragrance when the Buddha's name is 'fragrant,' and it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma can hold the name of that Buddha, then he'll know the border of the umbrella.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰傘蓋際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知幢邊際。
translation: At the point where the Buddha's name is Canopy, it's now said that if a teacher of the Dharma exists, he can hold on to the name of that Buddha and attain knowledge of the extreme of Banner.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰幢邊際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知作燈際。
translation: There's the limit of a buddha's name being called a banner, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear that buddha's name, then he'll know the limit of making a lamp.

source_sentence: 有佛名曰作燈際，　　現在說法人師子，　若能持彼佛名號，　　即得了知光明際。
translation: There's a Buddha whose name is the limit of making lamps, and it's now said that if a teacher or son of a man can bear the name of that Buddha, he'll know the limit of his radiance.
